name: Red Riding Hood Storybook tale
description:
SUPER FUN STORY, interactive book with multiple endings. Have FUN, play and discover multiple endings in this classical story.

Help Little Red Riding Hood choose her PATH and save your Granny from the Big Bad Wolf.

An Interactive Book App with images, music, decisions and multiple endings.

"Little Red Riding Hood interactive Pathbook" is available today, you get to choose the course of this storybook online, become the main character, choose your path wisely and discover our multiple endings.

Pathbooks short stories for kids. The classic story of Charles Perrault and the Grimm brothers.

This Interactive Book App is published by Living a Book. This is not only a book, or gamebook, or chat stories, or a simple interactive story, it's a spectacular PATHBOOK.

Once upon a time, there was a sweet little girl loved by everyone who knew her; but her grandmother was the one that loved her the most, she made her all sorts of gifts.
On one occasion, her grandmother gave her a beautiful red velvet hood. The little girl looked really pretty and she loved it so much, she never wore anything else, so everyone called her “Little Red Riding Hood”.

One day, her mother asked Little Red Riding Hood to go into the woods and take a basket of food to her grandmother who was sick.

What food should Little Red Riding Hood take to her grandmother?

Choice 1- Cake and some cocoa.
A sweet cake and hot cocoa is what she needs to feel better.

Choice 2- Fruit and orange juice.
Fruit will give her the energy to recover soon.

Choice 3- Delicious chicken soup with veggies.
A delicious chicken soup with some veggies is what a sick person needs.

Read the book and decide what happens next. Choice Wisely.


Have FUN reading. A Wonderful Book with music, illustrations, and unexpected endings.

LIVING A BOOK KIDS
A reading adventure.


Ordinary people, book lovers, and writers from around the world are writing our books. Be part of this adventure and become the author of your own interactive book. You just need to write the story and Living a Book will design, program and publish it as an application.

Do you like Grimm's fairy tales? This is not a simple Princess story for kids, it's a spectacular reading experience.

Little Red Riding Hood entered the woods heading towards her grandmother’s house. She walked without any distractions, singing and hopping around. Suddenly, she ran into a wolf. Red wasn’t scared because she didn’t know how mean wolves were.

“Good morning, Little Red Riding Hood.”
“Good morning, Mr. Wolf.”
“Where are you going so early? What’s in the basket?” he asked.
He seemed to be very nice, what should Little Red Riding Hood do?

Choice 1- I’m going to grandma’s house.
Red explains that she’s taking food to her grandmother.

Choice 2- Don’t tell him anything.
She tells the wolf that she isn’t allowed to talk to strangers.

Read the PATHBOOK and choose wisely.

Living a Book
A Reading Adventure
